post_text: A virtual celebration Wednesday honored Germantown High School's Ms. Leshundra Young as one of four 2019 Presidential Award for Excellence in Mathematics and Science Teaching (PAEMST) state-level finalists. The PAEMST award is the highest honor awarded to a K-12 educator each year by the U.S. Department of Education and the White House. As we await the announcement of the 2019 state-level winners, MDE hosted a special remote celebration honoring Ms. Young, attended by MDE representatives, GHS and District administrators, and family of the honoree. post_text: Grab and go meals, now including breakfast, are available free of charge to all children 18 and under during the school closure. Meals are available for free to all children regardless of where they go to school, but they do need to be present to receive a meal. Adults may purchase grab and go meals for $6; this price includes two meals in one bag. As circumstances may change, this plan is subject to change as well.

Students from all across Madison County Schools experienced the MCS Multicultural Expo on Tuesday, February 11, 2020, at Madison Central High School. Two shows, one in the morning and one in the afternoon, featured multicultural entertainment including traditional Mexican dancing, presentations from foreign language clubs, poetry readings, Indian drumming, choral performances in a variety of languages, and ballet dancing.

More than 500 English as a Second Language students from all Madison County Schools enjoyed the opportunity to attend the Expo and learn about the many different cultures represented in Madison County Schools. Also, all third-grade classes from Madison County Schools were invited to attend the event.

post_text: Congratulations to Mrs. Vina Gowdy of Velma Jackson High School! Not only was she surprised as our Madison County School District Teacher of the Year, but also she learned that the Academy of Multimedia at Velma Jackson, which she directs, has earned national recognition as a Model Academy! The Academy of Multimedia at VJHS is the only one of its kind in the state to earn this recognition, and only the third academy program in Mississippi to receive Model status. All three of those nationally recognized Model academies are right here in Madison County Schools. Congratulations once again, Mrs. Gowdy, and thanks to BankPlus for sponsoring our Teacher of the Year recognition program. #MarkofExcellence #MovingtheMark #CreateCollaborateCommunicate
